segment.source: Enable and disable add-ons using administrative templates and group policy
segment.target: Enable and disable add-ons using administrative templates and group policy

segment.source: Enable and disable add-ons using administrative templates and group policy (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Enable and disable add-ons using administrative templates and group policy (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Enable and disable add-ons using administrative templates and group policy
segment.target: Enable and disable add-ons using administrative templates and group policy

segment.source: Add-ons let your employees personalize Internet Explorer.
segment.target: Add-ons let your employees personalize Internet Explorer.

segment.source: You can manage IE add-ons using Group Policy and Group Policy templates.
segment.target: You can manage IE add-ons using Group Policy and Group Policy templates.

segment.source: There are 4 types of add-ons:
segment.target: There are 4 types of add-ons:

segment.source: Search Providers.
segment.target: Search Providers.

segment.source: Type a term and see suggestions provided by your search provider.
segment.target: Type a term and see suggestions provided by your search provider.

segment.source: Accelerators.
segment.target: Accelerators.

segment.source: Highlight text on a web page and then click the blue Accelerator icon to email, map, search, translate, or do many other tasks.
segment.target: Highlight text on a web page and then click the blue Accelerator icon to email, map, search, translate, or do many other tasks.

segment.source: Web Slices.
segment.target: Web Slices.

segment.source: Subscribe to parts of a website to get real-time information on the Favorites bar.
segment.target: Subscribe to parts of a website to get real-time information on the Favorites bar.

segment.source: Toolbars.
segment.target: Toolbars.

segment.source: Add features (like stock tickers) to your browser.
segment.target: Add features (like stock tickers) to your browser.

segment.source: Using the Local Group Policy Editor to manage group policy objects
segment.target: Using the Local Group Policy Editor to manage group policy objects

segment.source: You can use the Local Group Policy Editor to change how add-ons work in your organization.
segment.target: You can use the Local Group Policy Editor to change how add-ons work in your organization.

segment.source: To manage add-ons
segment.target: To manage add-ons

segment.source: In the Local Group Policy Editor, go to .
segment.target: In the Local Group Policy Editor, go to .

segment.source: Change any or all of these settings to match your company’s policy and requirements.
segment.target: Change any or all of these settings to match your company’s policy and requirements.

segment.source: Turn off add-on performance notifications
segment.target: Turn off add-on performance notifications

segment.source: Automatically activate newly installed add-ons
segment.target: Automatically activate newly installed add-ons

segment.source: Do not allow users to enable or disable add-ons
segment.target: Do not allow users to enable or disable add-ons

segment.source: Go into the Internet Control PanelAdvance Page folder, where you can change:
segment.target: Go into the Internet Control PanelAdvance Page folder, where you can change:

segment.source: Do not allow resetting IE settings
segment.target: Do not allow resetting IE settings

segment.source: Allow third-party browser extensions
segment.target: Allow third-party browser extensions

segment.source: Go into the Security FeaturesAdd-on Management folder, where you can change:
segment.target: Go into the Security FeaturesAdd-on Management folder, where you can change:

segment.source: Add-on List
segment.target: Add-on List

segment.source: Deny all add-ons unless specifically allowed in the Add-on List
segment.target: Deny all add-ons unless specifically allowed in the Add-on List

segment.source: Turn off Adobe Flash in IE and prevent applications from using IE technology to instantiate Flash objects
segment.target: Turn off Adobe Flash in IE and prevent applications from using IE technology to instantiate Flash objects

segment.source: Close the Local Group Policy Editor when you’re done.
segment.target: Close the Local Group Policy Editor when you’re done.

segment.source: Using the CLSID and Administrative Templates to manage group policy objects
segment.target: Using the CLSID and Administrative Templates to manage group policy objects

segment.source: Because every add-on has a Class ID (CLSID), you can use it to enable and disable specific add-ons, using Group Policy and Administrative Templates.
segment.target: Because every add-on has a Class ID (CLSID), you can use it to enable and disable specific add-ons, using Group Policy and Administrative Templates.

segment.source: To manage add-ons
segment.target: To manage add-ons

segment.source: Get the CLSID for the add-on you want to enable or disable:
segment.target: Get the CLSID for the add-on you want to enable or disable:

segment.source: Open IE, click Tools, and then click Manage Add-ons.
segment.target: Open IE, click Tools, and then click Manage Add-ons.

segment.source: Pick the add-on you want to change, and then right-click More Information.
segment.target: Pick the add-on you want to change, and then right-click More Information.

segment.source: Click Copy and then close Manage Add-ons and IE.
segment.target: Click Copy and then close Manage Add-ons and IE.

segment.source: From the copied information, select and copy just the Class ID value.
segment.target: From the copied information, select and copy just the Class ID value.

originalData.data: `Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features\Add-on Management`

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management Editor and go to .
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management Editor and go to .

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

originalData.data: `Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features\Add-on Management`

segment.source: Open the Local Group Policy Editor and go to .
segment.target: Open the Local Group Policy Editor and go to .

segment.source: Open the Add-on List Group Policy Object, pick Enabled, and then click Show.
segment.target: Open the Add-on List Group Policy Object, pick Enabled, and then click Show.

segment.source: Show Contents box appears.
segment.target: Show Contents box appears.

segment.source: In Value Name, put your copied Class ID.
segment.target: In Value Name, put your copied Class ID.

segment.source: In Value, put:
segment.target: In Value, put:

segment.source: 0. The add-on is disabled and your employees can’t change it.
segment.target: 0. The add-on is disabled and your employees can’t change it.

segment.source: 1. The add-on is enabled and your employees can’t change it.
segment.target: 1. The add-on is enabled and your employees can’t change it.

segment.source: 2. The add-on is enabled and your employees can change it.
segment.target: 2. The add-on is enabled and your employees can change it.

segment.source: Click OK and close the Group Policy editor.
segment.target: Click OK and close the Group Policy editor.
